posts.title: Deno 2.1.7, Project Idioms
posts.author: R. S. Doiel
posts.abstract: Notes on some of the file and code idioms I'm using with Deno+TypeScript projects.

posts.title: Deno 2.1.7, points of friction
posts.abstract:
A short discussion of working with file input in TypeScript+Deno coming from the
perspective of Go's idiomatic use of io buffers.

posts.title: Installing Deno via Cargo and other options
posts.abstract:
Notes on setting up a Debian flavored Linux boxes, macOS and Windows to install Deno via `cargo install deno`,
`curl -fsSL https://deno.land/install.sh | sh` or
`iwr https://deno.land/install.ps1 -useb | iex`

posts.title: When Deno+TypeScript, when Go?
posts.abstract: Brief discussion of when I choose Deno+TypeScript versus Go for work projects.

posts.title: Transpiling & Bundling with Emit
posts.abstract:
A brief discussion of using the Deno emit module to transpile and bundle
TypeScript.

posts.title: Raspberry Pi 4 & 400 Power Supply Issues
posts.author: R. S. Doiel
posts.abstract: Quick notes on some low voltage issues I ran into with my Raspberry Pi 4 and 400 using the stock power supply with thumb drives.

posts.title: Rust tools for Web Work
posts.abstract: A quick review of a PageFind and FlatLake by Cloud Cannon. A brief description of how I use them.

posts.title: Rust tools for Web Work
posts.abstract:
A quick review of a few Rust based command line tools I find myself
enjoying for web development.

posts.title: Limit and offset for row pruning
posts.abstract: Noted are how to combine a select statement with limit and offset clauses with a delete statement to prune rows.

posts.title: SQLite3 json_patch is a jewel
posts.author: R. S. Doiel
posts.abstract: Quick note about json_path function in SQLite3

posts.title: Quick tour of Deno 2.0.2
posts.abstract:
A quick tour of Deno 2 and the features I enjoy. Deno includes thoughtful tooling, good language support,
ECMAScript module support and a good standard library. Deno has the advantage of being able to cross compile
TypeScript to an executable which makes deployment of web services as easy for me as it is with Go.

posts.title: Web GUI and Deno
posts.abstract: My notes on two Web GUI modules available for Deno.

posts.title: RISC OS 5.30, GCC 4.7 and Hello World
posts.abstract:
These are my notes on learning to program a Raspberry Pi Zero W
under RISC OS using GCC 4.7 and RISC OS 5.30

posts.title: Exploring RISC OS 5.30 on a Raspberry Pi Zero W
posts.abstract:
In this post I talk about my exploration of using a Raspberry Pi Zero W
as a desktop computer. This was made possible by the efficiency of 
RISC OS 5.30 which includes native WiFi support for Raspberry Pi computers.
